definition: impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with
(negative prefix)/not/no
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: It was almost impossible to get a car mended in Lundazi, or even to replace a battery.
sentences.chinese: 在倫達孜你休想修車，連換電池都辦不到。

sentences.english: Going alone to a mother-and-baby group or the shops was out of the question.
sentences.chinese: 獨自去母嬰團體或商店也辦不到。

sentences.english: It was impossible to remove that riveted aversion I had to him.
sentences.chinese: 要除去我對他所懷的極深的厭惡，那是辦不到的。

sentences.english: It is impossible to achieve zero casualties.
He tried to cover up his mistakes but in vain.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖掩飾他的錯誤，但辦不到。

sentences.english: Pompey had cleared the Mediterranean of pirates, which is something that our governments can't seem to do.
sentences.chinese: 龐貝清除了地中海的海盜，這點我們政府似乎辦不到。

sentences.english: They hope to control this but they cant.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望控制這一切但事實上他們辦不到。

sentences.english: I tried to fight against sleep, but couldn't.
sentences.chinese: 我試着強制打消睡意，但是辦不到。

sentences.english: To succeed in India, outsourcers must square this circle.
sentences.chinese: 要在印度成功銷售，外包商必須做到他們辦不到的事。

sentences.english: But no one – not even Mr Buffett – can hope to replicate Warren Buffett.
sentences.chinese: 想要複製巴菲特神話？這恐怕連股神本人也辦不到。

sentences.english: What was impossible for her to have was the thing we had no idea of.
sentences.chinese: 我們想象不出還有什麼東西是她所辦不到的。

sentences.english: No one is a light unto himself, not even the sun. Antonio Porchia.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人可以做自己的明燈，即便是太陽也辦不到。

sentences.english: China would never be bullied into any change of its policy.
sentences.chinese: 要想硬逼中國改變政策是辦不到的。

sentences.english: He will never be bullied into any change of his standpoint.
sentences.chinese: 要想硬逼他改變自己的立場是辦不到的。

sentences.english: To doubt her truth or good intentions was impossible;
sentences.chinese: 懷疑她的真情實意是辦不到的。

definition: to have nothing to say (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
things like this (idiom); and so on/and the rest/etc
unwilling
well-tried/time-tested
a tiny bit/a wee bit
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
about a year
to be confused/to be baffled
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
nothing serious/just hot air
